title: Straight to perma-banned, no 14-day suspension or game chat restriction
body: Yes i was being toxic in 2 games, mainly because I had to deal with teemo both times. I still played the game, didn't int or dc but I was technically being toxic and unsportmanslike so yes I was doing the wrong thing but straight to perma-banned? Not even a 14-day suspension or game chat restriction. I have played league for 7-ish years and i have never been suspended or banned before. I have invested i think approximately $100 into this account and have some rare skins and invested probably 1500 hours into this account.

replies.body:
The system is unable to give you an instant perma for toxic behaviour, you must have received at least a 14 day ban prior to a permanent suspension for such offences.

The only circumstances that will result in an instant permanent suspension are:
- cheating/illicit 3rd party program use
- chargebacks
- security bans (ban placed on the account until ownership is verified)

It's within the realm of possibility that you could receive a perma from a manual review of your accounts behaviour, but they would have to be pretty exceptional circumstances.

My account did not fulfill the criteria of the 3 points you have mentioned.
I am sure I have not previously been punished with a 14-day suspension and if I did, it must have been a long time ago and should be excluded in this instance.

In that case I would strongly suggest you take HeartVine's suggestion and ticket support. They'll be able to give you more context on why you were punished. 

It is possible (though I was under the impression this had been fixed) that you were hit with a double punishment. This used to occur occasionally when a player would receive a punishment for one game, but get into a second before it could be applied, and then also earn a punishment for that game, effectively skipping a punishment tier.

I can only speculate though, support will be able to confirm the reason for your punishment and any prior history that may or may not have contributed.

As Seras said, there's only a few things that can result in an instant perma-ban. To find out which, I'd recommend checking the Reform Card (in-client pop-up) and email (sent to registered email address) which *should* provide some information regarding the punishment, possibly with some form of supporting evidence.

You might also want to get in touch with [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and see if they can provide more information about what has happened, or if you can find something that gives you a category for the ban you can appeal. In the case of cheating/3rd party program (and more general things like chat or gameplay punishments) you should use the "Account suspensions or restrictions" option. In the case of a chargeback ban, you'll want to use the "Has your account been suspended for a chargeback?" option (will be near the bottom of the list). In the case of a security ban, make sure you're logged out and use the "Recover my account" option (they'll ask a bunch of questions, you don't have to answer all of them, just enough to prove beyond reasonable doubt that you're the original account owner).
